## PDF Reader for Windows 10: The Best Softwares to Download

A PDF Reader is an essential tool for everyone who works with documents on a daily basis, and Windows 10 comes with a built-in PDF reader. However, the in-built tool may not be as functional as you wish, leaving you to look for other alternatives to meet your needs. Here, we review the best PDF Reader softwares for Windows 10. 

### Adobe Acrobat Reader DC

Adobe Acrobat Reader DC is a popular PDF Reader software that comes with Adobe Acrobat DC, which is a subscription-based tool. The free version allows users to open, view, print, and annotate PDFs. While the paid version includes advanced features like editing, converting PDFs to other formats, merging and signing PDFs, among others. 

#### Pros

- Comes with a full set of features even in the free version 
- User-friendly interface 
- Integrates well with other Adobe tools 
- Supports all types of PDFs

#### Cons

- Slow at times especially if documents are large 
- Subscription-based models are relatively expensive 

### Foxit Reader 

Foxit Reader is a free PDF Reader software that offers multiple features such as PDF creation, editing, annotating and digital signature tools. Foxit Reader supports Windows 10 and has a full range of pro features available at a premium rate. 

#### Pros

- Fast and lightweight 
- Enables users to fill out PDF forms 
- Includes collaboration tools for sharing PDFs with other users 
- Free trial of the premium version available 

#### Cons

- Pop up to install other Foxit products can be frustrating 
- Advanced versions are relatively expensive 

### SumatraPDF

SumatraPDF is a free PDF Reader software that is specifically designed to work on Windows 10. It is lightweight and offers features such as page rotation, search, and zoom capabilities. SumatraPDF primarily focuses on speed and ease of use, and itâ€™s perfect for the casual user who only needs to view documents. 

#### Pros

- Extremely lightweight 
- Opens PDFs quickly 
- Supports other file formats like ePub, MOBI, and CHM 

#### Cons

- Limited functionality 
- Not suitable for advanced PDF editing or manipulation 

### Conclusion

In summary, Adobe Acrobat Reader DC, Foxit Reader, and SumatraPDF are excellent PDF Reader softwares for Windows 10. Each software has its own features and advantages, and the choice ultimately depends on your specific needs. We suggest Adobe Acrobat Reader DC for those who want an all in one solution, Foxit Reader for those who require more editing capabilities and SumatraPDF for those who need a lightweight PDF Reader for quick document viewing.
